name: (2E)-1,3-benzothiazol-2-yl[(4-chlorophenyl)hydrazono]ethanenitrile
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1084
Reason: 1,3-Benzothiazole has a melting point of around 100°C due to its rigid structure and hydrogen bonding potential. The presence of two phenyl groups in the base structure can increase the melting point by approximately +20°C each, totaling +40°C. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, raising the melting point by approximately +50°C. The hydrazono group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, contributing approximately +20°C. The ethanenitrile group introduces a polar carbonyl interaction, raising the melting point by approximately +30°C. Summing up these changes: 100°C (base), +40°C (two phenyl groups), +50°C (chlorine), and +20°C (hydrazono and ethanenitrile).
